title: Poor quality - do not buy
body:
I am not sure how this could be Germany quality. In fact, this thing lasted no longer than the cheapest airpot I have purchased elsewhere. As others have mentioned, the item is actually manufactured in China. Despite the seller's assurance that this has "long-term durability" and the quality from Pykal, it is nothing but.

As some others have noted in their reviews, the pump eventually pumps less and less liquid over time. This is due to the fact that the plastics used on the pumping mechanism is very cheaply made and gets brittle over time. Every single time you open and close the lid, you are essentially applying pressure to that plastic piece up top which eventually results in it cracking and the seal broken (hence very little water comes out with each pump.) The worst part is (as you can seen in the picture) -- tiny particles of the plastic gets mixed in with the water which becomes unsafe to use.

Unfortunately, this item lasted only about 2 years, and upon contacting customer service about it, they simply said this was beyond their warranty period and fail to assist further. Save your money and buy something of better quality. This is no better than the other cheap garbage that's out there.

I was tired of making my tea one cup at a time, or making a pot of tea, only to have it last for 3 possibly 4 twelve oz cups, the last three of which were lukewarm or cold. I grew up drinking Early Grey, but I can no longer tolerate the caffeine (insomnia). After trying zillions of varieties of herbal teas, and not really enjoying any of them much, I had almost quit drinking tea. Then I discovered Vahdam's herbal spiced turmeric teas, and I am back at tea drinking again (Yay). So then I decided to figure out how to best make 64+ oz of tea in the morning and be able to drink it just-brewed hot throughout the day!
After finding a large enough teapot (Harold Import Co's 75 oz, 12-cup Ceramic teapot - A++), the perfect infuser for this teapot (House Again's "Extra Fine Mesh Tea Infuser" - with arms A+), I then researched carafes extensively and ended up purchasing Pykal's 68 oz "Thermal Coffee Carafe With Therma-Click Lid."
This Pykal Thermal Carafe comes with clear instructions on how to best use this carafe so it will keep your tea or coffee piping hot all day (12-15 hrs), or even after 24 hours (this is best done by pre-heating the carafe with boiling water for 30 minutes, then Completely Filling the carafe as directed - the tea or coffee will then be piping hot). I preheat the carafe with boiling water in the morning for about 15-30 minutes (more is better). Once my tea is prepared I pour out the boiling water, and pour in the tea, and close the lid securely. For the rest of the day, I can click open the lid (press it down), and pour myself a freshly brewed-tasting cup of hot tea. I am in heaven.
At the end of the day I just rinse out the carafe. It comes with an effective, good quality, long-handled sponge cleaning utensil specifically made for the carafe. I only use the sponge utensil about 1x/wk with a drop of dish detergent, really just for the heck of it, because the tea I am drinking doesn't stain like coffee or black tea. So after just over 1 month of use, it still looks brand new inside and out.
It also pours well and without incident. After reading a review that mentioned leaking, I filled the carafe with hot tap water all the way to the top, sealed it, and then slowly inverted the carafe as if to pour. No water leaked from my Carafe. Since then, I haven't needed to hold the carafe past a 45 degree angle when pouring out the end of the tea in the carafe and haven't experienced any leaks (no need to tempt fate).
And after all of this, the Carafe also comes with a warranty. It is a quality product made by a company that stands behind its products and offers quality customer service. Now I have my eye on their tea kettle! I am So Happy! I am just really happy with this purchase, and I rely on reviews (real ones) for just about every purchase I make, and am grateful for those who take the time. I am not a paid reviewer, nor a representative of Pykal.

title: This Airpot is great for hot and cold beverages alike!
body:
I purchased the Pykal SplashProof Coffee Carafe Airpot Dispenser with Adjustable Nozzle, and so far I think it is great! I've had it for a couple of days so far. First of all it holds up to 120oz, so nearly a gallon of capacity, which is plenty enough for me and my family members. When I received it, it came well packed in a nice box. It came with a cleaning brush and an easy set of instructions. It also has information to register for a 1 year warranty, and a link to instructional videos online plus an ebook.

I had no trouble setting it up and filling it with hot tea for the first trial. Setup is easy and fast. It kept the tea good and hot for well over 7 hours, and by that time I didn't need to keep the tea hot any longer, although I am sure it would have worked for a much longer time.

I like that the base swivels and allows me to easily turn the Airpot around to any direction while it is sitting on the counter. I also really like the extendable nozzle, which lets me pour into a shorter mug or a taller vessel with a simple adjustment, and avoids any spills. I found that pressing the top was easy, and my 11 year old could do this to dispense his drink with no issues as well. You can press the top and hold it down to get more liquid until it stops or your cup is full, and I found it shouldn't take more than a couple of presses to fill a small cup.

After the first filling with tea, I made pink lemonade with ice, and used the Airpot to dispense that. The Airpot kept it nice and cold for many hours.

When I was all done using the Airpot, cleanup was easy, just rinsing it out with hot water and a little soap. You can run some through the spout to clean that part as well, then just run some clean water through to make sure the soap is out. The included brush will be useful for cleaning I imagine after I have used the Airpot more, but I haven't even needed to use that so far, water has done the trick.

Next I am thinking I will try hot chocolate in the Airpot, it should do great for that. It would no doubt be awesome for coffee drinkers as well, but I don't personally drink coffee. I am very happy with this purchase, and I think I will be using the Airport quite a bit for various beverages.

title: LARGE CAPACITY STYLISH CARAFE THAT KEEPS WARM BEVERAGES WARM
body:
I generally make coffee using a manual plunger type device (AeroPress). This is fine for the two of us. The problem is this is not timely for a crowd. I use a Chemex pour over carafe when entertaining. However, for visitors staying over several days, even a Chemex is problematic when guests do not get up at the same time and may want good coffee throughout the day. That's where the Pykal thermal carafe comes to the rescue.
The first thing I needed to verify for myself was its heat keeping qualities. I did my own test by preheating the carafe with hot tap water for ten minutes per the instructions then filling the carafe with 195F water. I tested the temperature drop using an instant read thermometer at 12 hours and 24 hours. The water started at 188F and dropped to 159F at twelve hours and 142F at 24 hours. This was a home test not a lab test. Ha Ha. Heat keeping duties passed with flying colors.

The Pykal thermal carafe will more than meet your needs. It looks elegant and would be at home alongside your best coffee service. It is as easy to use as pressing a button and pouring a wonderful cup of coffee that tastes like you just made it even if you "just" made it six hours ago! No messing around for your guests having to put a small packet of ground coffee beans in a contraption and waiting for mediocre coffee to come out.
It also has some nice features besides the click n pour. Your guests may not notice but you will appreciate the stainless steel insides and outside, the non-skid bottom and the ergonomic handle as well as the dust proof pour spout. And Pylal packs a long handle sponge cleaning tool that actually reaches the bottom of the carafe! How nice is that?

I highly recommend this product. You'll by happy with it.

title: Works great at keeping coffee hot!
body:
I purchased this hoping for a thermos type container that will keep my coffee hot through the day in cold temperatures. I was not disappointed! I filled it with coffee in the morning from my coffee maker (I did not super heat it to boiling or anything like that, simply brewed a pot and poured it in, then added cold creamer). I dispensed one travel mug worth of coffee immediately and then left the Airpot in my truck on a day where temperatures ranged from 12 to 18 degrees F. I dispensed a second travel mug worth at my break a few hours later and the coffee was still steaming. Same at lunch time. At the end of the day (12 hours later in those cold temperatures), I dispensed one last cup just to see how warm it still was expecting lukewarm coffee by that point (cold temperatures outside plus now only having half a carafe left). I was surprised! The coffee was still hot! Not quite steaming at that point, but certainly not lukewarm. This Airpot worked well!

Another bonus with this Airpot is the included cleaning brush. It would be difficult to clean the inside of this Airpot without the brush and having one included is a great thought. There is even a little spout cleaning brush hidden in the handle to clean the spout.

One minor note for using this Airpot: I was using it for my tall travel mug and thus had to dispense my coffee off the side of my tailgate to fit my cup under the spout. This Airpot is meant for shorter mugs, Styrofoam cups, etc., not a tall travel mug. I will probably be giving this to my church to use during fellowship times because of that since they use the styrofoam cups for coffee and tea. This Airpot would be perfect in that environment!

One possible minor area of improvement would be the ring on the bottom of the Airpot, meant to enable the Airpot to turn. The ring is simply plastic and did slide on my counter a little instead of turn. It could be because of a slick counter top, but I feel if there was a rubber bottom to this plastic ring, it would work better at holding it's grip to the counter top and allowing the Airpot to turn. This is a very minor detail and was not enough for me to deduct a star. I wanted a container to keep my coffee hot for an extended period of time in cold weather, and this Airpot does that wonderfully!

title: Cannot Clean Cap and Material Affects Flavor
body:
The two major and one minor negatives, unfortunately, outweigh the two major positives.

I use my carafe for expensive specialty coffee from coffee farms all over Colombia that I purchase directly from the main plantation that exports it all. The different varieties of specialty coffee have their distinct flavor profiles and characteristics of the different locales from around the country, some quite coveted.

I brew 80 grams at a time to make 1 L of coffee, I do this twice in a row to make 2 L batches, use a Chemex pour-over system, and grind the beans within 2-5 minutes of brewing.

PROS

1) The 68 oz (2 L) capacity allows me to make and store 2 L of coffee.
2) The carafe is able to keep the coffee very hot for several hours. 12 hours later it is hottish. 24 hours later there is some warmth.

The lab-tested 150° F heat retention claim is not realized in actual practice. If you fill the carafe to capacity and do not use any of the liquid, 24 hours later it might still remain pretty hot. But the smaller the amount of hot liquid that you keep in the carafe the less effective it is at heat retention.

So if you decant amounts of liquid from the carafe over the course of 24 hours, it only stays hot for about 6-8 hours, then degrades to hottish by 12 hours, and after 24 hours is just warm. Still, I think at this time there is probably no other carafe that performs better at keeping liquids hotter for longer.

CONS

1) There is no way to open the cap so that it can be washed.

The surfaces that the coffee touches inside the cap cannot be reached directly to scrub and cannot be reached with a brush. It can be clicked open and set inside a container of soapy water, then rinsed under a faucet and soaked with clean water to finish rinsing.

Drying is a problem. You cannot wipe the inside of the cap dry. You can click it open and shake it until most of the rinse water is gone, but you cannot completely dry it. Allowing tap water to eventually evaporate dry is not good in my situation where I go out of my way to remove tap water contaminants. Wiping dry with a paper towel would be satisfactory, but cannot be done with this cap.

The only way for me to remove contaminants from the hot, tap rinse water is for me to use my specially filtered (ClearlyFiltered) water, intended solely for brewing the coffee, for a final rinse to remove as much residual contaminants as possible before using it for a new round of coffee. The fact that you can't wash the inside of the cap means this carafe is unsatisfactory.

2) The material of which the thermal reservoir is made imparts its own flavor on the contents. This makes this carafe totally unacceptable.

The reservoir is not made of glass but rather some metallic material. This metallic material has a flavor of its own that is transmitted to whatever it is holding hot. I do not know if this affects liquids intended to be kept cold. The sole purpose of this carafe for me is to retain the heat of freshly brewed specialty coffee.

I put considerable effort into extracting the exquisite flavors of what is sometimes extremely expensive coffee. The Moka I have just received from the plantation sold out in less than a day and is about $44/pound. The 2 L batch I brew costs $15.56 just for the beans. I don't want to taste the inside of my carafe along with the Moka or other specialty coffee.

But that's what happens. I pour a couple of large vessels of coffee right out of the Chemex brewer, the best it will ever be. But then I have to keep it somewhere to stay hot throughout the day. So it goes into this carafe that changes the flavor. It absolutely degrades the flavor and value of the coffee, so this carafe is only a short-term solution until I can get one that works good enough, can be thoroughly cleaned, and does not change the flavor of my coffee.

3) Finally, when the liquid is poured it does not pour smoothly, it splatters.

The liquid goes from the reservoir through the cap and out to its spout. It then splatters into whatever vessel is receiving the liquid. There is no smooth pour of any kind. The spout looks like it will pour smoothly, but it does not.

The spout shape has nothing to do with how it pours. It just comes out of the cap into the spout area in a more of a fan than a stream which causes the splattering. This effect occurs from the first pour to the last. It is a design flaw, but one I could live with if the cap could be washed and the material of the container did not impart its own flavor on the hot liquid it is holding.

title: Hot coffee all morning and no burnt taste.
body:
I really like my new Pykal Airpot. It is big enough to hold two pots of coffee from my 10 cup coffee maker and it keeps the coffee hot all morning. I really don't like the taste of coffee that has been sitting on the burner for an hour or two and it can take my brother and I that long to drink a pot of coffee. Sunday morning, after receiving the Pykal Airpot on Saturday afternoon, I preheated the pot with hot water out of my electric tea kettle and put two pots of coffee in it. The last cup was just as hot as the first.

I tested the Airpot shortly after I received it on Saturday afternoon. I fill the pot with boiling water from my electric tea kettle and let it preheat while I ran water through my coffee maker. After pouring out the water used for preheating, I poured in the hot water from the coffee maker, closed it up and ran another pot of coffee through the coffee maker and poured that pot in the Airpot. It fit, so no wasted coffee for two pots of coffee. I checked the temp of the water in the coffee maker at 1:30 pm EST and it was at 199 degrees F. After an hour, it was at 198 degrees F. I then went about my day, and forgot about the Airpot. Around 7:30 pm EST, I checked it again and the water was 194 degrees F. That's plenty hot enough for coffee. The pot was full all day, so that may have had some effect, but I think that was pretty good.

When the Airpot was recommended to me, the main selling point was that the pot kept hot liquid hot and cold liquid cold. I can say it worked very well on hot liquids. It was easy to clean, although I use a soft bristle bottle brush and a drop of dish detergent to clean out the Airpot.

I can hardly wait for tailgating season. We start our tailgates early and I always need coffee.

title: Awesome Airpot!
body:
First of all, let me say, the folks at Pykal are concerned #1 with customer satisfaction. If you have any problems whatsoever with their products, they are just an email away. They have come up with an amazing airpot!

It's beautiful stainless steel inside and out, and I can operate it with one hand even with osteoarthritis in all the joints of both hands. The pull-down spout is one of my favorite features. It lets you direct the liquid into a regular cup or a larger mug with NO splashing. The swivel base is a nice touch, and is smooth as silk when you rotate it. The claim that it keeps liquids hot for 24 hours is the truth. I started with a full pot of hot water at 205 degrees Fahrenheit. Two hours later, I dispensed three cups of water which were still at 190 degrees. Several hours later, a cup of dispensed water was still at 175 degrees. The next morning, almost 24 hours later, the dispensed water still measured 135 degrees. This pot would perform perfectly for a group gathering that was going to last several hours for sure. The coffee, tea or hot chocolate would still be nice and hot and drinkable at the end of any multiple-hour gathering. It has a generous 120 oz/3.5 liter capacity.

One problem I have with most airpots is that they drip after dispensing requiring a paper towel under the spout to keep from collecting a puddle of water. The Pykal pot had a very minimal drip of maybe one or two drops after dispensing.

I highly recommend this airpot. I can imagine using it for family gatherings at holidays or for things like a book club meeting or committee meeting for an organization.

The pot comes with a one year guarantee which you register online. They have a great video for proper use, care and cleaning of the aipot.

title: Says what it does, Does what it says
body:
I roast and grind my own beans and brew my coffee with a vacuum pot, so I’m a bit fanatical about good coffee. The only downside to a vacuum pot is that, as with a pour over, the coffee does not stay hot in the pot. It’s not a problem if I’m just making coffee for myself, but if I have multiple guests staying with us, it makes the morning coffee routine cumbersome and problematic. Solution? Get a really good coffee thermos, where I can have two full pots of coffee ready and waiting. To put it simply, this thermos says what it does and does what it says.

After reading some of the reviews, I started by cleaning it well, first with soap and water ( the inclusion of the cleaning brush is a helpful touch), then vinegar, and a good rinse with boiling water. Next I filled it with boiling water, sealed it, and checked the next morning to test it’s efficiency. It was still piping hot! I dumped that water out, then began using the pot regularly, never experiencing any kind of aftertaste issues. While you are brewing your coffee, fill the pot about a quarter of the way with hot water to warm the interior, just so you won’t be putting hot coffee into a stone cold thermal carafe. If you fill it pretty full and seal it as recommended, your coffee will stay hot all day. Of course as you drain the quantity, the thermal mass goes down, more air space is introduced, and the remaining coffee will cool faster, but if you have a number of people partaking of coffee, you will still easily get through a service with everyone enjoying their beverage piping hot. This is a very good thermos at a very reasonable price point. It is simple and modern in appearance, well balanced, easy to pour from, and easy to clean. I would definitely recommend it!

title: Has a design flaw
body:
I like the carafe, it keeps things hot for quite a while, but it has a design flaw. If you tip it too high the liquid pours out around the seal. I spoke with the company and while they tried to be helpful (even offered to let me exchange it for another product) they stated that the design of this carafe did not allow for you to pour out the last of the contents.

Watch the video and you will see what I'm talking about. This works fine except when I get down to my last cup of coffee, at which point I have to tilt the carafe at an angle where the coffee spills out around the seal and onto my hand. I almost burned myself the first time this happened. Now that I know about it, I just make sure to pour the last cup over the sink with my hand out of the way.

The design flaw is where the spout is (see photo). There is a rubber seal on the lid so that when closed it seals against a rim on the carafe. The problem is this rim does not extend to where the spout is, so there is no seal there, allowing the liquid to bypass the seal and pour out around the lid. They could have easily extended the rim all the way around the top, leaving a passage underneath to allow the liquid to pour out but keeping the seal.

I still use this because I like how long it keeps things hot and I like the look and I enjoy the push to open feature of the lid. I just have to remember not to pour the last cup of coffee all over my hand.

title: Kept the tea piping hot and reasonably easy to clean
body:
Spot on on the heat retention. So-so for the cleaning. For those who complain about heat loss, you are doing it wrong. Always pour hot water (water from the pipe is better than nothing) into the flask to heat up the sides before pouring the tea/ coffee in. This will make sure that heat is not robbed from the drink to heat up the sides. That will definitely keep the heat in.

For the cleaning part, this is definitely better than other pots that I have used. I was able to remove the stem and send a straw cleaner down the spout to clean. The pot itself was another affair. A bottle brush cleaned the bottom and sides pretty easily. The part under the lid attached to the part is pretty difficult though. You have to do some gymnastics. That said, some good hot water, soap and some vigorous shaking combination did the trick but still unsatisfactory as I cannot see the results. I air-dried it to make sure that no moisture smells accumulate.

I will definitely recommend this product though as there are very few options in this price range to keep things hot for an elongated time. I use one for heat and one for cold and do not mix the two.

Anything can go wrong with a transaction. What really matters is how well a problem gets resolved and Lily really has done a great job. They even include a specialized cleaning device.

Highly recommended.
author: Linda M. Stern
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 20 de abril de 2020

title: Fantastic for Coffee
body:
So I drink much coffee. I like the K-Cups, but I also travel around a lot, and I was looking for something I could put in my truck, with a little car improvement work, so I could carry coffee around and have it stay warm, but also easy to dispense. This carafe has worked great for that. It carries much coffee and keeps it warm for a long time. Plus it is easy to distribute, push the pump button!

When you are not using it, you can push in the spigot and lock the button, so it makes it almost impossible to accidentally spill or make a mess. It also helps for different sized mugs when you are dispensing coffee from it.

It came with a nice little cleaning handle and sponge, like a Swiffer only for cleaning not dusting. So it is easy to keep clean when you need to, even on the go. Not to mention it is remarkably easy to take apart to clean.

I really like this unit and so far even being bounced around out in the oil fields, it is holding together nicely and I can also use it to fill a thermos if I am leaving the truck for a while.
author: Mitch
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 8 de marzo de 2019

title: It's very good and keeps coffee warm a long time.
body:
The small opening makes it's more challenging to get the inside to clean. It's replaces one I have that has a wide opening that I can get my hand in and really scrub the inside, but I realize that the large lid is most likely where a lot of heat is lost, so it's a bit of trade off on design goals.
The click lid, when closed is very good at not leaking and keeping heat in. But we sometimes are not good about remembering to close it after use. Maybe there could be 2 options sold, one with a click lid, and one with the same tight internal seal, but a thumb lever to release it when pouring.
As some other reviewer pointed out, the last few ounces don't pour out too easily, and can make a mess if carafe is turned completely upside down with the lid open. I found that when trying to get the last couple of ounces out, it's better to take the lid off.
author: Randall
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 12 de agosto de 2020

title: 5 stars for the customer service
body: I bought the thermal airpot last Nov for boiling water only cos I am a big fan of tea, it worked perfect until recent, the water couldn’t keep the temperate even for 6 hours, I noticed the outside was hot after I poured the boiling water in, fortunately it’s still in one year warranty, I reached out to the seller PYKAL for my issue, the manager Lily wrote me back right the next day and checked with me for some details, I took a video showing the outside increased temperature from 77 to 98 within half an hour after boiling water was added, Lily confirmed they would send me a new one as replacement and I also got one year warranty for that one! It took less then 7 days from I submitted my claim to get a new thermal airpot. although the first one didn’t last too long, I would give 5 stars for their good service, at least I know they are standing behind their products. Btw, make sure you don’t drop or hit the carafe, it will cause the heat leakage as per the seller.
author: Y. Shi
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 24 de septiembre de 2020

title: Easy to use and it does keep things hot for a long time, I actually tested it!
body: I bought this to bring to a monthly craft group get together where we don't have access to a kitchen. So since this was the largest carafe I could find that still had a carrying handle, I ordered it. I really like it a lot. It's easy to carry, even when full, and it is simple to use. I also filled it with very hot water and then took temperatures of the water with my instant read digital meat thermometer. (probably not the best thing to use, but it is what I had on hand). Well, when I first filled it up with hot water (and I DID pre-warm the carafe with hot tap water for 10 minutes first, then dumped it out), the water measured 198 degrees F. Four hours later it was 180 degrees F. At 12 hours from starting it was 140 degrees F and at 22 hours from start it was at 125 degrees F. Finally at 24 hours the water registered at 120 degrees F. I am VERY happy with this carafe and have already told others in my craft club where to buy it.
author: Gayle
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 9 de abril de 2019

title: I didn’t know how much I needed this.
body:
I drink tea all day long from a 24-ounce insulated mug. I usually heat water each time my mug is empty. With the Airpot, I am able to heat water once in the morning and make tea as needed during the day with piping hot water. My mug is tall, so I swivel the Airpot toward the sink and can easily fill it without a splash using the convenient pull-down nozzle. Also, I have essential tremor, so I have spilled a lot of water when carrying it from the microwave and attempting to pour it into my mug. The Airpot solves that problem. I heat the water in my stainless Pykal teapot, and pour it into the Airpot for hot water all day. If I press firmly on the button, I can fill my mug with one press.

I much prefer stainless steel for items like this, as it is easy to scrub away odors. Including a cleaning brush is a very nice touch that shows customers that Pykal really has customer satisfaction in mind when designing their products and packaging. The Airpot has a nice weight and seems very sturdily made. I didn’t know how much I needed this, but it has made my life easier!
author: Diana Z
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 23 de febrero de 2019

title: Very good product and excellent customer service!
body:
I wanted an airpot for use on a beverage table during family gatherings and at church for Special events. I saw many features that I thought would be useful, Such as the large quantity of coffee that it would hold, the length of time that the coffee would be kept warm, and the splash proof nozzle. I also noted that the Pykal AirPod was highly rated, and so decided to place an order.

The air pot arrived quickly and in time for a special event on the weekend. I immediately tested the air pot to see that it would work properly for my event. I had some trouble with dripping from the spout and so I contacted customer service at Pykal.
Lily, the customer happiness manager 🙂, Was very helpful with remedies, ideas, and lastly with a replacement stem. I found the customer service outstanding and the replacement stem has made the air pot work very satisfactorily. I would recommend this company and this product
author: FDG
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 12 de febrero de 2021

title: SAFETY???
body:
SAFETY: I liked the fact that the height of the spout can be adjusted to a lower position because I felt there would be less chance of anyone getting burned. BUT...what I didn’t foresee is that a tall mug will not fit under the spout. I have to position the carafe at the edge of the counter, facing out, so that the spout overhangs the counter. Then someone holds the tall mug under the spout (which defeats my safety concern). A mug 4.75 inches will fit under the spout when the mug is sitting on the counter. . A mug 5.0 inches tall will not fit under the spout when the mug is sitting on the counter.

If you never use a mug taller than 4.75 inches, you will have no concerns and will love this airpot.
author: Linda Powers
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 29 de diciembre de 2020

title: Perfect! Keeps coffee hot for hours! Just what I needed!
body: We recently went from one coffee drinker in the family (me) to three coffee drinkers, all wanting their coffee at different times. My aging father recently moved in with us, and my teenage son has started drinking coffee. This excellent carafe was the perfect answer! Whenever each one wants coffee, it’s hot and ready! I make 80 oz. of fresh ground coffee first thing the the morning, and after pouring my first cup, I fill the 2 liter carafe for others. Sometimes it’s a couple of hours, and I’ve left for work before my father is up for breakfast! When he has his breakfast, the coffee is hot and ready. We have two Bonavita Coffee Makers (excellent btw) which do not use hot plates to keep coffee warm (or scorched). This carafe is perfect for that! It will also be great to have this carafe when we host holiday family events, when I can’t usually stay ahead on the coffee for everyone. Now when family arrives there will be a carafe of fresh, hot coffee already to go while the next pots are brewing.
author: KC Royals Fan from Independence, MO
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 7 de noviembre de 2019

title: Big Bang for Your Buck
body:
The carafe came well packaged and with a very detailed instruction sheet. Included was also a cleaning brush, which is designed to clean your thermal carafe without scratching the metal interior.
It holds almost 2 liters of liquid, which surprised me.
Clean your carafe before use with warm soapy water and rinse out well.
Do follow the instructions of leaving hot water in the closed carafe for at least 10 minutes before you empty it and fill it with your actual beverage of choice.
I use it for tea and even after 18 hours the tea was too hot for just drinking it down. I'm very impressed with this thermal carafe and would highly recommend it. Do read the instruction manual and follow the steps. You will have a great product that should last for a long time.
And the e-book that you can access on their website has some fantastic coffee recipes if you are a coffee lover.
author: Karin C.
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 29 de septiembre de 2020

title: **BEST OF ALL AIRPOTS**
body: After i bought few of Thermal Coffee Carafe by PYKAL 68Oz/2 liter, such as i love , used one for hot coffee/one for cold drinks & one for Creamer , Then end up buying this AIRPOT 2 from AMAZON 2, Since i have Prime member AMAZON delivered it to me NEXT DAY , i just love this, NICE SOLID STRONG Airpot, NO plastic inside such i love, & keep the HOT or COLD all day, i use it MOST for Coffee & keep it HOT all day on the counter for guesses in weekends or take it to work in office ..VERY well Built in quality , easy to clean & comes with own brush, Solid stainless steel , JUST love it ..PYKAL make GREAT products & like usual LOOVE German made products and engineering... DID A GREAT CHOICE , Very happy with this Airpot :)
author: 80SChild
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 30 de junio de 2020

title: Good one
body: This is a good find to put your coffee in before it Cooks for 2 hours and becomes strong. This one does work real close to what the manufacturer says for hold time if you follow the instructions. It has some nice features a lock on the lid, the pump is fast/ 3 times to fill a cup, extension on the spout, and a handle you carry it around. I eventually figured out it has little wheels to make it turn to one side or the other. The only negative I found it does have a drip / you need to have a catch pan. I don't think you can find any better company than this one to take care of any problems. They responded very quickly to my issue and sent me a brand new pot for a broken spring. Can't say enough about her ( Lily) quick response to my problem. Thank you
author: cal 1964
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 4 de junio de 2020

title: Exceptional Customer Service
body: I purchased this product and wanted to try it out for a few weeks before writing this review. I have purchased other products from this company and have been very pleased with the quality and performance; this product was no exception, 5 stars. It is the customer service that brings me back to purchase from this company.....just exceptional! Do follow the directions and pre heat before putting in hot liquids. I use boiling water from the kettle. Allow boiling water to stand for a good 5 minutes and shut the lid while doing this and your coffee stays hot for hours. I also heat my mug. I want" hot "coffee throughout the morning, not medium hot, and this product delivers. It is so easy to clean and they supply a sponge cleaning tool, takes less than a minute to clean. The handle is also useful for moving it around. Highly recommend without reservation.
author: ANNE
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 26 de abril de 2019

title: Really keeps your beverage warm all day!
body: I am using this pot to keep tea warm all day. My husband works from home and is a big tea drinker however a tea pot does not stay warm and were too small. I was really surprised at how long this keeps hot. I make his tea in the morning and leave it on the counter. I steep it with 6 tea bags for about 10 minutes then remove the bags and set it up. It stays hot all day. I start it at 5 am and its still hot in the evening. Infact its still warm in the morning when I clean it out and start it again. It comes with a cleaning brush and is easy to clean. I am really happy with this and its heavy duty much like what you would see in a restaurant. I highly recommend for hot beverages.
author: Misty
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 30 de julio de 2020

title: KEEPS COFFEE HOT!
body: This carafe replaced a glass lined carafe that we have been using for about 30 years. The best thing about this carafe is that it keeps the coffee really hot! I have had no problem with pouring the coffee out down to almost the last drop as some other reviewers have said. The little flap that covers the spout doesn't bother me, however it may be the reason why the last ounce or two doesn't come through - not enough pressure to open it. I just take the cover right off and pour the last little bit into my cup. No problem, and it's HOT. The best thing about the glass carafe is that you could keep it really clean with a little baking soda and hot water. So I was happy to receive the cleaning brush that they include with this new carafe.
author: BDM
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 24 de agosto de 2020

title: Quality product
body: This is just a little too large for everyday use by my small family of two. We don’t make enough coffee to fully fill this, but even so, it keeps the coffee warm throughout the day, without that burned taste that you get if you leave it on the warmer or reheat in the micro. The coffee is still warm enough to drink the next day! You are supposed to rinse the carafe with warm water before filling it in order to preheat it for keeping the coffee warm and this works well for small amounts. This carafe would be really helpful at a dinner party or a feast event where you expect many guests. You could make the coffee hours before desert and keep it hot instead of that mad post dinner rush where your guests are sitting around waiting for coffee but you can’t make fast enough in your little coffee maker!
author: silkee
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 11 de septiembre de 2019

title: Large capacity and keeps liquids very hot ( and cold) for hours
body:
This is a big thermos.and holds a decent amount of clear liquids, with an extended spout and it works great. It definitely keeps the clear liquid contents very hot for hours. I haven't tried it with cold liquids but I am sure it will work the same. I normally have to keep the lid open to cool down the hot contents before serving others.
If you slide the button on top it opens and locks the thermos. Great for traveling and beach.
author: talitha1225
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 20 de junio de 2021

title: Keeps coffe HOT
body: This bottle really keeps coffee hot. It isn't perfect. The design of the cap and spout could be better. The contents of the bottle must pass through the cap though a valve. The seal works well and it may help with insulation. But, I would not put hot chocolate in it. I don't know how one would clean the cap. Then the little flap on the spout is all that stands between the user and a big mess. I think it would be much better if the cap opened when the mechanism was up. And sealed when pressed down. The cap works backwards. If the cap opened when up the contents of the bottle would not need to pass through the cap.
author: Kindle Customer
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 8 de febrero de 2020

title: Really Works!!!
body: This is a terrific product! I am staying in the hospital with a child and wanted easy access to hot tea. I originally bought a small electric hot water pump pot, but it was confiscated (due to safety concerns & they said they will return it upon discharge)!!! I ordered this last week. On Friday, I preheated it as instructed, full of boiling hot water for 10 minutes, and then refilled it with hot tea. That was at around 3:30 PM. 16 hours later, the tea was still so hot that I had to wait for it to cool before drinking. Over 24 hours later, and mostly drained, tea is still very warm. I would really recommend this for someone who wants to keep a hot beverage hot for a long time.
author: "kaybooks"
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 5 de diciembre de 2020

title: Wonderful for keeping beverages hot or cold
body: I absolutely LOVE this Airpot and we used it multiple times while we were out. It is so easy to fill with either a cold or hot beverage and take along a picnic.... It kept the hot drinks hot and the cold drinks cold for well over 12 hours. We really think this will be used in our house so much more than just for picnics and outings because we host a lot of family events during the warmer months and can't wait to use it for tea, lemonade or coffee. It's nice to have something to keep drinks whatever temperature we need for hours at a time. The swivel base will make it easy to access when on a table with other drinks and the adjustable spout helps from splashing especially with a hot beverage. The cleaning wand that came with it definitely made cleaning it so much easier.
author: Melissa
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 5 de marzo de 2019

title: nice airpot
body: I haven't owned or closely examined any other thermal airpots- but this Pykal airpot seems to work fine so far. Like all non-electric carafes/airpots, the fluid stays hotter for longer the more volume of hot liquid there is in the airpot. Because the capacity of the airpot is fairly large, hot water poured close to capacity will remain hot longer than with my 2 L Pkyal carafe. I have been very pleased with the 2L Pykal carafe, and find this larger one to be up to par. I have to admit the long black spout may not be the most attractive. I don't know what the basis is for the long spout, but there must be a reason- why use extra material if not needed? Needless to say, I have no problem with the looks, even though my daughter giggled when she saw it.
author: M. S. Lee
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 5 de marzo de 2019

title: Excellent Airpot
body: I chose this airpot over other brands because of its features especially the adjustable spout and swivel base. The carafe material seems sturdy and looks like it will last long. I have used the airpot twice now - brought it to an outdoor gathering in the early evening. The heat kept, even in the cold weather. I am very happy with this purchase. My only gripe is that using my boiled regular tap water leaves residue in the carafe and stem and makes it twice as hard to clean. A mixture of vinegar, baking soda, and water and some scrubbing did the trick (customer service recommendation). I have yet to try using commercial bottled water to see if it solves the residue issue. Overall, this is an excellent airpot.
author: Inspector Mills
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 20 de noviembre de 2020

title: Pours like a duck with a hole in the lip but Hotter Than Heck!
body: Doesnt matter if it stays hot 12 hours bc it will be empty before then but it certainly has stayed hot as heck from 8am until nearly 5pm and I have had instant oatmeal and several cups of tea with it. Not allowed electric kettles here at work but we have a hot spout in an upstairs breakroom. Filled the carafe up in the am and its still super hot with steam now at the end of the day. There is a slight “defect” in the pour. It splatters a little if you try to pour too fast and there is not possible way to get the last bit out without taking off the top and holding it upside down. Its not a big deal and this is a great pot!! Would highly recommend.
author: TTR79
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 17 de agosto de 2020

title: I can't believe how long coffee stays hot!!
body: I purchased this carafe so I could provide coffee to my training customers. I was stopping at the "donut shops" and getting their big box of coffee, but for two boxes we were spending around $40! I bought a small coffee maker and two pots fill this perfectly! Even with the purchase of the coffee pot and coffee, I was saving money after the second training! I have used it about 10 times since!! The extendable spout makes ensures that it doesn't spill when dispensing! My last pot was filled at 7 am and when I got home and cleaned the pot 12 hours later, the coffee was still hot!! I was blown away!
author: GriggAByte
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 9 de junio de 2021

title: The company delivers on their promises.
body: After 15 yrs of camping, my old thermal carafe began to leak so when I read the reviews on the Pykal thermal carafe I was excited. I received the carafe in a timely manner, it looked nice and felt sturdy. After reading the instructions, I filled the pot 90% full with boiling water and in 24 hours it was still hot. Fantastic! I thought I had found a great replacement, but not so! The initial thermal carafe was defective apparently missing some type of seal ring. After emailing the help service and sending them a video of the problem, they promptly sent me another carafe. This new carafe is an excellent replacement. It keeps the water piping hot, the customer service was prompt and as they advertise "hassle free". I would highly recommend this carafe and this company.
author: Clifford A Baker
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 2 de octubre de 2019

title: Great Product and Customer Service
body: When I received the carafe, I went to the website to register it. The dropdown menu did not include this model number so I wrote to customer service to ask what to do. Within a very short period of time, I received an answer with an apology and instructions. I actually emailed again and again received a very quick reply. I felt that it mattered that I was satisfied. Customer service matters a lot to me. Today, I used the carafe for a party. I followed the instructions to preheat the carafe with boiling water for 10 minutes. The coffee remained hot for the entire party. A few hours later, when I went to clean the pot, the coffee in it was still hot. I am very pleased with both the product and the service. Two very good things.
author: Maria
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 14 de septiembre de 2019

title: Where have you been all my life?
body:
My family is a big tea drinker and this Airpot has made hot tea readily accessible throughout the day (and the next) for everyone. It's like having a bottomless pot. The heat retention is great. It's not as scalding hot the next day but it's hot enough where you still have to take your time and sip slow.

Initially, I didn't think the swivel base was necessary but it has made it that much more convenient where I can just spin to where I'm standing. The adjustable nozzle is great for preventing spills and splashes. The travel thermos doesn't fit underneath the nozzle but all you have to do is set the pot sitting at the edge of the table/counter and voila! Overall, I love this Airpot and it has already become a permanent fixture in our kitchen.
author: Yongsun75
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 19 de febrero de 2019

title: Holds entire pot of coffee
body: Purchased this to replace a carafe that was hard to clean and didn't hold the entire pot. This one does both. Only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is only keeps hot for about 6-7 hours, where-as my old one of a different brand was a good 24 hours
author: Janet C.
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 1 de enero de 2022

title: great customer Service
body:
I bought the Pykal Thermal coffee carafe about 1 year ago. Worked great, kept coffee HOT all day, maybe even longer, I just never tested it for longer.
After a year the Thermaclick lid kept sticking, I contacted Pykal to see if I could just purchase a lid, Voila, for $8.00 and within 1 week, I was back in business! I so appreciated not having to go buy a whole new Thermal carafe. The customer service was prompt, courteous, they kept me updated, outstanding. Would definitely recommend doing business with Pykal.
author: june dunne
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 12 de noviembre de 2021

title: Read the Directions- Your coffee will STAY HOT!
body:
I bought two of these for our church and after a few weeks, bought two more because they are so awesome.

If you fill the carafe up with hot water and fill it up, it will literally stay warm for DAYS.

We use them extensively on Sundays. I go to church on M or T, sometimes Weds to straighten up and get ready for the next gathering. If there is coffee left, that liquid is still warm, if I do it on Mondays, it's still HOT. It really does keep your coffee hot. We've had lots of compliments that they're easy to use and keep the coffee hot.
author: Monetina
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 28 de abril de 2021

title: Lives up to its promise-Keeps it hot!
body:
"The Airpot arrived as promised and has functioned well. It has lived up to its promised of keeping beverages hot. In fact I made hot tea for work one morning and primed it with hot water before filling it with my tea and bringing it to work. I work 12-13 hour shifts and had 3 scheduled in a row. The Airpot kept my tea hot all day long, but the surprising thing happened quite by accident. I forgot to bring it home that night and was amazed the next day that my tea was still hot! In fact it stayed hot that entire second day until the tea was gone. Great product! Can’t wait to try iced tea in it.
The adjustable nozzle also makes it easy to fill any cup with minimal splash or spill.
Great product.
author: Thomas J. Wisinski

title: Does what it promises...keeps coffee hot
body:
I've tried three different carafes over the past few years and am really happy with this one. I make French press coffee every morning and it's important to get it out of the press and into a carafe because you want to get it off the grounds, plus the press is glass and doesn't keep coffee warm.

This carafe keeps the coffee plenty warm for about two hours (haven't used it for longer than that on any day), has a very secure top and pours fine. It's one of those products that actually does what it says it will do. Highly recommended.
author: Maggie the reader
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 10 de mayo de 2021

title: Works great but doesn't look like a $40.00 airpot.
body: We got this pot for our morning coffee. It works well ,we filled it at seven AM this morning and drank most of the coffee. It's after midnight now and I went and checked it and the coffee we left in it is still HOT enough to drink ! One thing I don't like is that we have some taller ceramic cups and they won't fit under the new type spout. One other point I would pass along is the stainless body of the airpot looks as if it was done by hand by a child. Yes it doesn't look like a professional job to say the least.
author: Kindle Customer
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 2 de marzo de 2019

title: Keeps coffee hot
body: I have only had the carafe for a couple of days but when I first used it, my coffee stayed very hot for many hours. I did not preheat the carafe before pouring the coffee in and had no issues with it staying hot even when the coffee level was at 50% full. We had some coffee left in the carafe (1 mug amount) after 12 hours and it was not hot but still warm. We are pleased so far. The carafe is very nice looking and easy to clean. I like the push button on top of the lid to release the coffee. Would consider this as a wedding gift or house warming. Very nice and worth the money paid.
author: Dallas Texas Girl
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 23 de septiembre de 2019

title: Great product - As per expectations
body:
Love this thermos. I use his as my night time thermos for water. Plenty of storage, good flow. Only one slight issue is that my wife finds it a little hard to push the dispensing button on the top. Everything else is good.

Update - After about 3 months of usage, I notice that the spout dribbles a few seconds after releasing the button... which is a bit irritating as you have to continue holding the glass to catch the last few drops thatbdribblenout with a lag.

Is there something I'm doing wrong as I haven't seen similar complaints?
author: shethsa
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 8 de septiembre de 2019

title: Keeps the heat if you preheat it.
body: It is probably the best stainless steel carafe I ever used. I always preheat with boiling water before using. It keeps the heat longer that any other carafe I ever used and I used quite a few. I would definitely buy it again and recommend it to others. The only reason I gave it an overall rating of 4 instead of 5 is that after filling the cup it drips for a second or two. It doesn't splash but it drips. You have to keep the coffee cup under it till it stops or get used to cleaning the area.
author: Mohd A.
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 28 de octubre de 2019

title: Keeps our coffee hot as expected.
body: We use it for hot coffee only. We really like the way it pours without spilling and dripping. It keeps our coffee nice and hot for several hours and I am confident that if we filled it with hot coffee after pre-heating it and didn't drink it for twenty four hours it would still be at an ideal temperature. I did use a therma pen instant read thermometer 24 hours after we had drank some so it wasn't filled to the recommended level and it was still at 140 degrees F. The only thing that time will tell is if the spring loaded lid will eventually stick and have to be replaced. The carafe is easy to clean and we are 100 %satisfied with it.
author: Amazon Customer
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 14 de agosto de 2019

title: Great customer service and a great product!
body: This is the first Amazon review I have ever posted, but I had to give this company a shout out! Our carafe works incredibly well, keeping our coffee hot for many hours. Their customer service is even better! Our thermal klick lid stopped working after a while but it was no longer covered under warranty. None the less, the owner herself made sure we received a new lid and was very kind throughout the entire transaction. Can't go wrong with this product or company!
author: Elizabeth Carroll
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 11 de octubre de 2021

title: Don't waste your money.
body:
What utter C rap. Worked fine for the first week. Then the pumping mechanism got weak. On my third cup it would only dispense about a tablespoon of hot water for every lpump. Then it just sputtered and splashed all around but the cup hot water and by the time I had half filled the cup, my wrist was hurting from pushing on the darn thing. Also, I had noticed the top of the airpot was warm. I figured heat escaped through there. So I put a hat on it. Worked to keep the water hot for a while longer (maybe I just imagined it. Who knows).

title: Hot Mess
body:
Hot mess perfectly sums up this product.

The short and sweet:

Pro:
It keeps drinks hot.

Con:
It sprays that hot liquid every time you click the top.

Full review:

I have worked from home due to Covid and my basement office is rather inconvenient for refills during morning meetings. I bought this to pour the pot in and keep me going through zoom fatigue. I will start by saying it’s great for keeping coffee hot. I have good coffee all day from this. The negative comes when you open the lid. It has a click top that is intended to make it easy to seal and then open for pouring. Unfortunately, that means it seals the pressure from the hot liquid built up. Every time you hit the button it sprays hot coffee. I’ve tried using an open hand to press the button but all that does is force it out the spout. I want to like this and it might not seem like the end of the world but the best way to explain is a wet fart.. it might not ruin anything but it is going to require some cleanup and it’s always inconvenient..

I would not recommend this product.

title: It's great if you want to drink it all RIGHT NOW
body:
This product earn three stars from me because it is indeed easy to clean, easy to use and it's durable. It comes with it's own brush which is quite sturdy and also a plus. I've never owned an airpot and was unsure how to use and clean it. The item comes with an insert for you to register it at their website and it says there is a video on how to use it, but all I could see were more and more instructions on how to register it. That's okay because one read-through of the written instructions and you're all set.

The problem I have with this is that since I have tea and coffee drinkers in the home, I do not want to use the airpot to hold either coffee or tea, but rather very hot water. I certainly want the taste of rich Bustelo in my delicate Jasmine tea. Plus in the long run it'll be much easier to keep clean if I put only water in it.

I put water in the airpot at 212 degrees (boiling). I immediately poured myself a cup of hot water, and it measured at 178 degrees. Not even 10 seconds had passed. About three hours later, I poured another cup of water and it was at 150 degrees. I believe this is how the product is described in the description.

However, you can't make a decent cup of tea at this temperature. I am particular about my tea, and I steep for 5 minutes at 205 degrees. Even the most delicate green tea must steep for 185 degrees for 5 minutes before it can be fully enjoyed. At 150 degrees, it will barely open my Jasmine pearls and by the time it has been sitting for 5 minutes, it's too cold. The same goes for coffee. It's fine if you want to pour and drink right away, but who does that? You get a very hot cup of coffee so that you can sip and enjoy.

title: Not hot for 24 hours
body:
So, this is rated at 150°F for 24 hours. Well, that was not my experience. I pre-heated this thing with near boiling water to the very top and left it in there for about 15 minutes. I have tested a few French presses over the years so I got them all out and made coffee in all of them at once so the coffee would be hot and ready at the same time. I emptied the water and poured the coffee in this carafe. It was actually more than the carafe could hold, so it was completely full. I put the dispenser in there and took a tiny pump out to test the temperature. I kept doing this every couple hours. By the next day, at 24 hours, my carafe had dropped from 167.5°F when I started to 116°F. I only took out a small pump which barely covered the bottom of a pre-heated mug to test it. It was mostly full the next day still. Even at 116°F the coffee was still hot enough to drink, but still not what I was expecting.

Anyway, using and cleaning this is easy. The pump comes right out of the center for cleaning and then you just have to wash the empty carafe. They even give you a brush to use. My bottle brushes are much easier and clean better, but hey, free brush is nice. Rinse it out, put coffee in it, put the pump in and shut the lid. Done. I like that it locks so I can keep my kids from going over there and hitting the button a million times. The pour spout can move up or down to accommodate multiple sizes of cups or travel mugs. That is super nice in my opinion. It doesn't splash all over the place with the shallow mugs. I found this really easy to use and was nicer than having to lift and pour a heavy vacuum carafe. I have nerve damage in my hands so this was very pleasant. I would have given it 5 stars for this, but the fact that the temperature dropped so much I need to take one off. I am still happy with this and continue to use it daily.

title: Perfect for Large Parties
body:
The SplashProof Coffee Carafe Airpot Dispenser is perfect for parties, BBQs and any other get together that has a large amount of people. It will hold 120 oz at any one time and keeps the beverage hot or cold for hours. It is important to know that this carafe is not for just a cup of coffee or two. When using you should start with the carafe being at least 90-95 % full with the liquid. If you don't fill it up adequately the heat escapes to the upper walls taking away the warmth where the beverage is. Directions state you should pour hot water in and let it sit for 10 minutes before pouring your coffee, tea etc in. This will warm up the inside of carafe which will keep the actual beverage you are serving hotter longer ( you can also keep cold beverages cold using cold water for 10 minutes).

There is a directional sheet that gives directions for using the carafe. The directions are given in words and pictures so it is easy to figure it out. You are suppose to clean the carafe after each usage to and not to let tea coffee or tea or any drink in the carafe for more than 24 hours. The cleaning process is my one concern. The lid area opens but does not completely come off. There are cleaning utensils included but you can't get your hand down into the carafe to wipe it dry . Water catches in the rim of the lid and because the entire lid does not come off you cannot turn it completely upside down.

When the product wasn't keeping heat as well as it did originally, I contacted customer service and they sent out a replacement under their warranty almost immediately. I cannot say enough about how great this experience has been. Highly, highly recommend.

title: Great - but large - product
body:
I bought this to replace an Ikea coffee pot who's stopper had broken. It is a fine replacement. We are a single coffee drinker household, so the 1/2 gallon capacity is a bit too large. It is great for entertaining and instances when two coffee drinkers are in the house.

I had a question on how to clean a piece of the coffee pot and they send me a video they made on the spot in an hour. Absolutely the best customer service. I highly recommend the product and comapny.
author: John Sikking
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 4 de junio de 2020

title: Finally...
body: Finally... an easy to use thermal carafe that is convenient and WORKS. My previous carafe had a lid that had to be pressed down after pouring. Sometimes someone would forget and my meticulously made French press coffee would get lukewarm shortly afterward. This carafe has a neat pop top in the center that unseals the carafe for pouring. After pouring you press again to seal. It is easy to see the unsealed position. The carafe comes with a cleaning utensil and has a wide enough opening to easily clean inside. I am very happy with this product at this price.
